```{r}
# Load Geneva temperature and precipitation data
GE_temp_prec <- read.table(here::here("data", "LA-climate-reports-tables-homogenized_GVE.txt"), header = FALSE, skip = 28, col.names = c("Year", "Month", "Temperature", "Precipitation"))

# First lines
head(GE_temp_prec)

# Convert Year and Month to a Date format
data <- GE_temp_prec %>%
  mutate(Date = as.Date(paste(Year, Month, "01", sep = "-")))

# Plot the temperature over time
ggplot(data, aes(x = Date, y = Temperature)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Temperature Evolution Over Time",
       x = "Date", y = "Temperature (Â°C)") +
  theme_minimal()
grid()
```

```{r}
install.packages("pxR")
library(pxR)
library(dplyr)
data <- read.px(here::here("data", "px-x-1106010100_104.px"))
data_df <- as.data.frame(data)
head(data_df)


# Aggregate data by Jahr and sum the value column
casualties_per_year <- data_df %>%
  group_by(Jahr) %>%
  summarize(total_casualties = sum(value))

# View the result
print(casualties_per_year)


# Install ggplot2 if you haven't already
install.packages("ggplot2")

# Load the ggplot2 package
library(ggplot2)

# Create a line plot of total casualties per year
ggplot(casualties_per_year, aes(x = Jahr, y = total_casualties)) +
  geom_line(color = "blue") +
  geom_point(color = "red") +
  labs(title = "Total Casualties per Year",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Number of Casualties") +
  theme_minimal()
```
